preqs: 12 credit points at first year level in Art History and Theory, or Theory of Art and Design, or Visual Culture,  or permission from Unit Coordinator

rules.ruleString: (Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {TAD3138} or  Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {TAD2138} or  Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {AHT3138})
Must be enrolled in course owned by {50000562}
Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {AHT%, TAD1%}

description: This unit focuses on the representation, design, experience and interpretation of space, both in Australia and abroad. Concepts of space and place are central to any understanding of modern society and culture and are at the forefront of scholarship and thought in several disciplines. This unit considers the aesthetics, politics and ethics of a wide range of social spatial environments, discourses and environments, with a particular emphasis on the  ideas of space as inclusion and space as exclusion.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
